alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued April 10 at 10:12PM PDT until April 12 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO 3 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 PM Monday to 3 AM PDT Tuesday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks. Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
